title: Persona pack + free chat: generation, chat UI, insight extraction
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — S5 Persona Pack + Free Chat, Background Jobs (generate_persona_pack, extract_chat_insights), Screen 7, Screen 8

Goal: Implement persona pack generation, free chat interface with persona, and chat insight extraction.

Key PRD references:
- generate_persona_pack(session_id) → persona_pack artifact
- Persona grounded in research findings
- Free chat with persona (Screen 8)
- Side panel during chat
- extract_chat_insights(session_id) → chat_extract + hypothesis updates
- Persona evidence: contradicted only if constraints directly negate claim
- Label persona outputs as simulation/practice
- Screen 7: Persona Pack, Screen 8: Persona Chat

Definition of done:
1. generate_persona_pack background job
2. Persona pack display (Screen 7)
3. Free chat UI with persona (Screen 8)
4. Chat side panel with context
5. extract_chat_insights job post-chat
6. Hypothesis status updates from chat insights
7. Simulation/practice label on all persona outputs

Acceptance criteria: AC-5 (persona pack generated + one chat conducted; insights extracted)

title: PSF report + export: report assembly, PDF/MD, shareable link
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — S6 Output, Background Jobs (assemble_psf_report), Exports, Screen 9

Goal: Implement the final PSF report assembly, PDF + Markdown exports, and tokenized shareable link.

Key PRD references:
- assemble_psf_report(session_id) → psf_report + exports
- Active 5 + status + disproof conditions
- What to test next: 1 test per hypothesis with pass/fail + 2 interview questions per hypothesis
- PDF export (one-page PSF report)
- Markdown export (Notion-ready)
- Tokenized URL with optional 7-30 day expiry
- Screen 9: PSF Report + Export

Definition of done:
1. assemble_psf_report background job
2. psf_report artifact (JSON)
3. Report display UI (Screen 9)
4. PDF generation (one-page layout)
5. Markdown export (Notion-compatible)
6. Shareable tokenized URL with configurable expiry
7. Download buttons for PDF + MD

Acceptance criteria: AC-1 (download/export report), AC-6 (Active 5 + status + disproof + tests + interview questions)

title: Desktop research: parallel research jobs + citation UI
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — S4 Desktop Research, Background Jobs (run_desktop_research), Evidence Status Rules, Screen 6

Goal: Implement run_desktop_research(session_id, wedge_override) — parallel research jobs for segment language, alternatives, constraints. Update hypothesis statuses and display citations.

Key PRD references:
- Parallel jobs: segment language, alternatives, constraints
- Status updates: supported | weakened | contradicted | unknown
- Auto-replace contradicted hypotheses if not locked
- Citations visible in UI
- Desktop evidence: contradicted only on strong, general conflicts
- Target: ≤5 minutes total
- Screen 6: Research Progress + Results

Definition of done:
1. run_desktop_research background job with parallel sub-jobs
2. Web/desktop research integration (search API)
3. Per-hypothesis status updates with rationale
4. Auto-replacement of contradicted unlocked hypotheses
5. Citation storage and display UI
6. Progress indicator during research
7. research_brief artifact produced

Acceptance criteria: AC-4 (desktop research shows visible citations)

title: Pitch input: audio recording, transcription, transcript editing
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — S1 Inputs (Pitch), Screen 2: Pitch Input, Pitch object

Goal: Implement pitch recording (30-45s audio), transcription, and transcript editing UI.

Key PRD references:
- Record 30-45s audio
- Transcribe audio (ASR integration)
- Edit transcript UI
- Audio deleted post-transcription (privacy)
- Pitch object: transcript_text, transcript_confidence, edited_transcript_text

Definition of done:
1. Audio recorder component (30-45s limit)
2. Transcription integration (ASR API)
3. Transcript edit UI with confidence display
4. Audio deleted after successful transcription
5. Pitch data persisted to session

Acceptance criteria: AC-1 (end-to-end), Privacy requirement (audio deletion)

title: Blocking clarifiers: S2 question UI + re-analysis
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — S2 Blocking Clarifiers, Screen 3: Clarifiers, Blocking Clarifier Logic

Goal: Implement the S2 blocking clarifier screen — display up to 5 questions, collect answers, trigger re_analyze_inputs if answered.

Key PRD references:
- Up to 5 questions across fixed categories
- Categories: customer specificity, trigger context, problem+consequence, current workaround, outcome/value
- re_analyze_inputs(session_id) on answer
- Skip S2 if no clarifiers needed
- Screen 3: Clarifiers

Definition of done:
1. Clarifier question UI rendered from vagueness_report
2. Answer collection and persistence
3. re_analyze_inputs triggered on submission
4. S2 skipped automatically if vagueness_report has no issues
5. Cap enforced at 5 total questions

Acceptance criteria: AC-2 (no more than 5 blocking questions mapped to fixed categories)

title: BOOTSTRAP: CI + branch protection + beads contract
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md

Goal: Establish workflow guardrails so agents can work autonomously.

Definition of done:
1) CI exists: .github/workflows/ci.yml runs on every PR
2) scripts/ci.sh (or Make targets) exists; CI fails if checks fail
3) GitHub main is protected: PR-only, required checks, 1 review, no direct pushes
4) AGENTS.md includes: only bd ready; claim-before-work; branch naming bd-<id>-<slug>; PR flow
5) QA checklist exists: docs/qa-checklist.md (or PR template)
6) Convention enforced: all new tasks blocked on this BOOT bead until it is closed

title: analyze_inputs: vagueness report + claim map background job
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — Background Jobs (analyze_inputs), Artifacts (vagueness_report, claim_map), Blocking Clarifier Logic

Goal: Implement the analyze_inputs(session_id) background job that produces the vagueness_report and claim_map artifacts.

Key PRD references:
- analyze_inputs(session_id) → vagueness_report, claim_map
- Drives S1→S2 transition
- Deterministic blocking clarifier logic based on vagueness_report
- 5 fixed categories: customer specificity, trigger context, problem+consequence, current workaround, outcome/value

Definition of done:
1. Background job triggered on S1 completion
2. LLM integration for input analysis
3. vagueness_report artifact produced (JSON)
4. claim_map artifact produced (JSON)
5. Clarifier questions derived deterministically from vagueness_report
6. Job status trackable by frontend

Acceptance criteria: AC-2 (no more than 5 blocking questions mapped to fixed categories)

title: Project scaffolding: tech stack, directory layout, dependencies
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — Full document (infrastructure prerequisite)

Goal: Set up the foundational project structure, choose and install the tech stack, configure build tooling, and establish the directory layout for the PSF MVP.

Definition of done:
1. Tech stack chosen and documented (framework, language, DB, etc.)
2. Project initialized with package manager and dependencies
3. Directory structure created matching PRD modules (sessions, inputs, hypotheses, research, persona, export)
4. Dev server runs locally
5. CI script updated to include lint/type-check for chosen stack
6. README updated with setup instructions

Acceptance criteria: Foundation for all subsequent beads.
close_reason: Scaffolding complete: shadcn/ui initialized with base components, drizzle migrations generated, schema CJS conflict fixed. All CI checks pass (tsc, eslint, vitest, next build).

title: Hypothesis manager UI: swap, edit, lock + wedge/ICP override
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — S3 Hypotheses, Screen 4: Hypotheses Manager, Screen 5: Wedge/ICP Edit Override

Goal: Build the hypothesis manager UI — display Active 5 + pool, allow swap/edit/lock, show inferred wedge/ICP with edit override.

Key PRD references:
- Screen 4: Hypotheses Manager (Active 5 + pool)
- User can swap/edit/lock hypotheses
- Show inferred wedge/ICP with edit override
- Screen 5: Wedge/ICP Edit Override
- Active 5 must always cover all 5 domains
- start_research triggered from this screen

Definition of done:
1. Active 5 displayed with full hypothesis rendering
2. Pool browser for swapping hypotheses
3. Inline editing of hypothesis fields
4. Lock toggle per hypothesis
5. Wedge/ICP inference display with edit override
6. Domain coverage enforced (can't remove last hypothesis in a domain without replacement)
7. start_research trigger button

Acceptance criteria: AC-3 (swap/edit/lock Active 5)

title: Hypothesis generation: pool creation + Active 5 selection
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — S3 Hypotheses, Hypothesis Schema, Background Jobs (generate_hypotheses)

Goal: Implement generate_hypotheses(session_id) to produce ~30 hypotheses and auto-select the Active 5 (one per domain).

Key PRD references:
- Generate pool (~30 hypotheses)
- Auto-select Active 5 (one per domain)
- 5 domains: segment reachability, pain severity/frequency, workaround inadequacy, buyer/payment path, adoption/switching constraints
- Hypothesis schema: id, domain, segment, context, claim, measure, disproof, evidence_sources, tests, status, confidence, rationale
- Rendered format: For {segment} in {context}, {claim}, evidenced by {measure}; contradicted if {disproof}

Definition of done:
1. generate_hypotheses background job implemented
2. hypothesis_pool artifact produced (JSON, ~30 entries)
3. Active 5 auto-selected covering all 5 domains
4. Hypothesis schema matches PRD spec
5. Pool and Active 5 persisted to session

Acceptance criteria: AC-3 (always maintain Active 5 covering 5 domains)

title: CVP input form: 8-field form with validation
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — S1 Inputs (CVP form), Screen 1: CVP Input

Goal: Build the CVP input form with 8 word-limited fields.

Key PRD references:
- 8 fields: For, In situation, Who struggles, Current workaround, We offer, So they get, Unlike, Because
- Word-limited inputs
- Screen 1: CVP Input

Definition of done:
1. Form UI with all 8 fields rendered
2. Word-limit validation per field
3. Form data persisted to session
4. Responsive layout
5. Form state preserved on navigation

Acceptance criteria: AC-1 (end-to-end completion)

title: Session management: state machine, session_id, export_token
description:
PRD: docs/prd-psf-mvp.md — S0 Start, Session object, State machine

Goal: Implement session lifecycle — create session_id + export_token, persist session state, and drive the S0→S1→…→S6 state machine.

Key PRD references:
- S0 Start: create session_id + export_token
- Session object: session_id, export_token, created_at, expires_at, current_state
- State transitions: S0→S1→S2→S3→S4→S5→S6
- MVP scope: single session, no accounts

Definition of done:
1. Session creation endpoint returns session_id + export_token
2. Session state persisted (DB or equivalent)
3. State machine enforces valid transitions only
4. Session expiry logic implemented
5. API tests for session CRUD and state transitions

Acceptance criteria: AC-1 (end-to-end session without accounts)
